a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of students achieving minimum reading proficiency in early
Minimum reading proficiency for early primary education means students in grade 2 can read familiar words and extract
information from sentences, while in grade 3, they read aloud fluently, understand short texts, and identify the main topic.
Share of students in early primary education
achieving at least minimum reading proficiency
Data source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics; World Bank (2024)
Note: This data omits children who don't attend school. Learning outcomes over time should be interpreted with caution.
